fields.definition: Corresponds to a particular report from SOPR
Standardized registrant
Notes whether or not the firm is a lobbying firm.
Raw client
Standardized client
Parent company to the client
Lobbying income/expenses
The standard five character code identifying the donor’s industry or ideology.
Souce of catcode

Indicate type of filing:
n means a non self filer parent.
m means a non self filer subsidiary for a non self filer parent.
x means self filer subsidiary for a non self filer parent
p means a self filer parent
i means a non self filer for a self filer parent that has same catorder as the parent
s means a self filer subsidiary for a self filer parent
e means a non self filer subsidiary for a self file subsidiary. Don't count this unless the e is bigger than the s
c means a non self filer subsidiary for a self filer parent with same catorder. Count it in both total and industry when IncludeNSFS is null. Don't count it in total or industry when IncludeNSFS=y
b means a non self filer subsidiary for a self filer parent that has different catorder. Count it in both total and industry when IncludeNSFS is null. Exclude from total and include in indus but mines it from the total of the parent when IncludeNSFS=y
To indicate if the filer included its non self filers affiliates activities
To indicate if this report should be used or ignored. The general method is to use the latest report.
To indicate if the amount on this report should be included to calculate industry totals.
The year.
A CRP short version of reports’ types. Look at the reference table “ReportTypes” for possible values
The long version of reports’ types. Look at the reference table 'ReportTypes' for possible values
To indicate if the major political contributor is an affiliate or not
Corresponds to a particular report from SOPR
Raw value of lobbyist's name.
Standardized lobbyist.
An ID assigned to each unique lobbyist.
The year.
Any previous government official position the individual lobbyist had
An ID assigned to members of congress and federal candidates. It will have a value if the lobbyist is a former member of congress
Notes whether the lobbyist is a former member.
Standardized client.
Standardized subsidiary.
Total amount by catcode
The year.
The standard five character code identifying the donor's industry or ideology.
Corresponds to a particular report from SOPR
An agency unique identifier
The government agency lobbied
Unique identifier for this table
Corresponds to a particular report from SOPR
A three-letter code corresponding to the general issue area.
The long version of the three letter general issue.
The specific issue.
The Year.
Unique identifier for this table
Corresponds to a particular report from SOPR
A three-letter code corresponding to the general issue area.
The long version of the three letter general issue.
The Year.
Unique identifier for bill
It is the specific issue unique identifier. It is a foreign key on this table
Congress number
The bill name

fields.description: Last year (even year) of the federal 2-year election cycle
Indicates reporting period. First two characters indicate the quarter (e.g., Q3) and last two characters indicate year (e.g., 03)
ID assigned to each 527 committee by IRS
Standardized committee name based on 527's sponsor.
Usually blank. For leadpacs, shows the sponsoring member.
The standardized parent organization for the organization listed in the CRP527Name field. If there is no parent identified, this field will be equal to CRP527Name.

A two-character code defining the type of recipient. For candidates, the first character is party ("D" for Democratic, "R" for Republican, "3" for Independent or third party, "U" for Unknown.) The second character is "W" for Winner, "L" for Loser, "I" for incumbent, "C" for Challenger, "O" for "Open Seat", and "N" for Non-incumbent. "N" is reserved for candidates that are neither in office nor running during the cycle in question. For party committees, the first character is party and the second character is "P." For PACs, the first character is "P" and the second character is "B" for Business, "L" for Labor", "I" for Ideological, "O" for "Other" and "U" for unknown.
FEC id for PAC if the same organization also has a PAC.
FEC id for electioneering communications PAC if the same organization also has one.
(D,R,3,I,L) Will be null or empty if committee is not a party, joint fundraising, leadership or candidate committee.
The standard five character code identifying the committee's industry or ideology.
Indicates how the PrimCode was determined.
'Q' if the 527 files quarterly, 'M' if it files monthly.
Committee type indicates whether the 527 is focused on state level politics ('S') or federal level ('F'). 'U' is unknown.
'L' for liberal, 'C' for conservative, 'N' for none, 'U' for unknown
Additional information about the 527, including web addresses, sources of information, and other notes about the organization.
The quarter and year in which the contribution was reported. The first two characters indicate the quarter, the last two the year.
An id field supplied by the IRS.
Standardized organization name for the 527 making the distribution.
ID assigned to each 527 committee by IRS
The recipient of the disbursement. This field is standardized when possible
Source used to determine ExpCode or ExpCode_Old.
A unique record identifier. This is added by CRP and is NOT consistent from download to download.
The quarter and year in which the contribution was reported. The first two characters indicate the quarter, the last two the year.
An id field supplied by the IRS.
A unique identifier for individual donors and their immediate families
The name of the contributor, usually in the format Last name, First Name.
The amount contributed. This will be negative for refunds.
The reported date of the contribution.

The standardized organization name for the contributor. This is usually based on the donor's employer if the donor is an individual. Otherwise it is the donor organization itself. The donor may not have an income producing occupation (e.g. homemaker)
The standardized parent organization for the organization listed in the Orgname field. If there is no parent identified, this field will be blank or null.
The standard five character code identifying the donor's industry or ideology. Usually based on Orgname (e.g., the orgname "Microsoft Corp" would normally get realcode C5120 for computer software.)
The recipient's id number. This is the IRS employer identification number.

A two-character code defining the type of recipient. For candidates, the first character is party ("D" for Democratic, "R" for Republican, "3" for Independent or third party, "U" for Unknown.) The second character is "W" for Winner, "L" for Loser, "I" for incumbent, "C" for Challenger, "O" for "Open Seat", and "N" for Non-incumbent. "N" is reserved for candidates that are neither in office nor running during the cycle in question. For party committees, the first character is party and the second character is "P." For PACs, the first character is "P" and the second character is "B" for Business, "L" for Labor", "I" for Ideological, "O" for "Other" and "U" for unknown.

The party (if any) of the recipient. "D" for Democratic, "R" for Republican", "I" for Independent, "L" for Libertarian", "3" for other third party and "U" for Unknown. In most cases, 527 committees are not formally affiliated with a political party.
The standardized name for the recipient.
The donor's city. This could be based on a home address or an employer's address.
The donor's state. This could be based on a home address or an employer's address.
The donor's zip code. This could be based on a home address or an employer's address.
M/F/U/N for male, female, unknown or ambiguous name
The code for the source used for coding Orgname, Ultorg and Realcode.
Rerfers to chamber the report was filed with. "H" for House, "S" for Senate, "E" for executive branch
Calendar year that is covered by report and that this record applies to.
Date when agreement was made or began.
Date when agreement was made or began.
Date when agreement ended. Agreement was not concluded if null or empty.
Date when agreement ended. Agreement was not concluded if null or empty.
Standardized version of first party to the agreement. Based on AgreementParty1.
Standardized parent organization of first party to the agreement. If none, this field will be null or empty.
Location information for AgreementParty1. City and state for example.
Second party to the agreement. Based on AgreementParty2. Understood to be the filer if null or empty.
Standardized version of second party to the agreement. Based on AgreementParty2.
Standardized parent organization of second party to the agreement. If none, this field will be null or empty.
Description of purpose and terms of the agreeement
"D" if record is duplicated in same or subsiquent reports and should not be calculated or displayed.

In combination with CalendarYear, the primary key. Starting with a letter, followed by two digits indicating the year, and then a 7 digit ID number. With the addition of the year in the ID, these should be unique by themselves but as of now cannot be assumed to be so.
Rerfers to chamber the report was filed with. "H" for House, "S" for Senate, "E" for executive branch
Unique CRP identifier for each candidate or executive branch member
Indicates if the report is an Annual Filing (Y), an Amendment (A), or a Termination (T)
Senate forms separate publicly traded assets (A) and non-publicly traded assets (B)
Indicates whether an asset belongs to the filers spouse (S), a dependent child (D), or is held jointly (J). If null we assume it is held by the filer.
Name of asset or account as reported by filer. If assets are held within an account, the name of the account appears here. If not, the asset itself will appear here.
Standardized parent organization of AssetSource. If none, this field will be null or empty.
Name of asset as reported by filer. Actual assets, when they are held in an account.
Standardized parent organization of AssetDescrip. If none, this field will be null or empty.
Combines City, State info into one field
Value range of asset as reported by filer
Exact value of asset when provided.

Income from an exempted fund. ("mutual fund, common trust fund of a bank, pension or deferred compensation plan, or any other investment fund, which is: 1)widely held, 2)publicly traded, or widely diversified,  and 3)held under circumstances where you neither exercise control over nor have the ability to exercise control over the financial interests held by the fund.") Applies to Senate & Exec forms only
Income from a qualified blind trust
Type of investment. Stock, real estate, etc. Used to determine which to count in industry totals.
Other than Div, Rent, Interest, CG
Indicates how much income was produced by asset.
Description of income amount or raw version of precise amount in AssetIncomeAmt
Asset was purchased during reporting period
Asset was sold during reporting period
Asset was exchanged during reporting period
"D" if record is duplicated in same or subsiquent reports and should not be calculated or displayed.
Rerfers to chamber the report was filed with. "H" for House, "S" for Senate, "E" for executive branch
"Y" for annual report, "A" for amendment, "N" for nominee or candidate, "T" for termination
Source of compensation as reported by filer
Description of duties performed in return for compensation
"D" if record is duplicated in same or subsiquent reports and should not be calculated or displayed.
Rerfers to chamber the report was filed with. 'H' for House, 'S' for Senate, 'E' for executive branch
'Y' for annual report, 'A' for amendment, 'N' for nominee or candidate, 'T' for termination
Gift recipient is filer jointly with spouse, spouse alone, or dependent child. Null or empty presumes filer was recipient.
Organization or individual who made the gift as reported by filer
'D' if record is duplicated in same or subsiquent reports and should not be calculated or displayed.
Rerfers to chamber the report was filed with. 'H' for House, 'S' for Senate, 'E' for executive branch
'Y' for annual report, 'A' for amendment, 'N' for nominee or candidate, 'T' for termination
Organization that paid honoraria, as reported by filer
Description of activities that earned the honoraria
'D' if record is duplicated in same or subsiquent reports and should not be calculated or displayed.
Rerfers to chamber the report was filed with. 'H' for House, 'S' for Senate, 'E' for executive branch
'Y' for annual report, 'A' for amendment, 'N' for nominee or candidate, 'T' for termination
Organization that paid income, as reported by filer
Income recipient is filer jointly with spouse, spouse alone, or dependent child. Null or empty presumes filer was recipient.
Value of income. Non-filer items can be reported as 'Over $1,000'
Value of income. Non-filer items can be reported as 'Over $1,000'
'D' if record is duplicated in same or subsiquent reports and should not be calculated or displayed.
Rerfers to chamber the report was filed with. 'H' for House, 'S' for Senate, 'E' for executive branch
'Y' for annual report, 'A' for amendment, 'N' for nominee or candidate, 'T' for termination
Person liable is filer jointly with spouse, spouse alone, or dependent child. Null or empty presumes filer is liable alone.
Organization or individual who made the loan as reported by filer
'D' if record is duplicated in same or subsiquent reports and should not be calculated or displayed.
Rerfers to chamber the report was filed with. 'H' for House, 'S' for Senate, 'E' for executive branch
'Y' for annual report, 'A' for amendment, 'N' for nominee or candidate, 'T' for termination
Position held with organization listed in PositionOrg
Organization with which position is held
Date filer began holding this position
Date filer began holding this position
Date filer stopped holding this position
Date filer stopped holding this position
'D' if record is duplicated in same or subsiquent reports and should not be calculated or displayed.
Rerfers to chamber the report was filed with. 'H' for House, 'S' for Senate, 'E' for executive branch
Raw asset name. If the asset is held within an account, the raw account name.
Standardized version of Asset4Transacted. (More reliable than Asset4Transacted. If errors are found in Asset4Descrip, they are corrected here but not in the raw field.)
If the asset is held within an account, the raw asset name.
Standardized version of Asset4Descrip. (More reliable than Asset4Descrip. If errors are found in Asset4Descrip, they are corrected here but not in the raw field.)

fields.reference: If Chamber='H', then RangesTransHouseOnly.Code. Otherwise, RangesAssets.Code (Also see DoleTransFactors

fields.description: Exact amount of transaction, if given.
Notes including other types than sold, purchased, exchanged.
'D' if record is duplicated in same or subsiquent reports and should not be calculated or displayed.
Rerfers to chamber the report was filed with. 'H' for House, 'S' for Senate, 'E' for executive branch
'Y' for annual report, 'A' for amendment, 'N' for nominee or candidate, 'T' for termination
Travel sponsor as reported by filer
City from which filer traveled to start trip
State from which filer traveled to start trip
Destination city where trip took place
Destination state where trip took place
City that filer returned to at end of trip (point of return)
City that filer returned to at end of trip (point of return)
Was lodging provided by TravelSource during the trip
Was food provided by TravelSource during the trip
Was travel for family members also provided by TravelSource
Description of portions of trip that were paid for at filer's expense
'D' if record is duplicated in same or subsiquent reports and should not be calculated or displayed.
